content.html:
The diffs are getting bigger so I put mine here: https://pastebin.com/UcafS4t0

By initializing objects in beforeAll in all three tests, I see that notification toggle !!!! only gets printed out once

Right they are only constructed at the beginning of each test,

But the problem was that the objects are still there even after the test ends.

for example 

diff -r 9e37dafaff16 -r 88a35d757cb1 gz3d/build/gz3d.js
--- a/gz3d/build/gz3d.js    Wed Oct 18 21:31:04 2017 +0800
+++ b/gz3d/build/gz3d.js    Fri Oct 27 09:06:33 2017 +0800
@@ -1095,8 +1095,8 @@

   guiEvents.on('openTreeWhenSelected', function ()
       {
-        this.openTreeWhenSelected = !this.openTreeWhenSelected;
-        if(!this.openTreeWhenSelected)
+        that.openTreeWhenSelected = !that.openTreeWhenSelected;
+        if(!that.openTreeWhenSelected)
         {
           $('#open-tree-when-selected').buttonMarkup({icon: 'false'});
         }
@@ -1109,8 +1109,8 @@

   guiEvents.on('toggle_notifications', function ()
       {
-        this.showNotifications = !this.showNotifications;
-        if(!this.showNotifications)
+        that.showNotifications = !that.showNotifications;
+        if(!that.showNotifications)
         {
           $('#toggle-notifications').buttonMarkup({icon: 'false'});
         }
diff -r 9e37dafaff16 -r 88a35d757cb1 gz3d/src/gzgui.js
--- a/gz3d/src/gzgui.js Wed Oct 18 21:31:04 2017 +0800
+++ b/gz3d/src/gzgui.js Fri Oct 27 09:06:33 2017 +0800
@@ -1090,8 +1090,8 @@

   guiEvents.on('openTreeWhenSelected', function ()
       {
-        this.openTreeWhenSelected = !this.openTreeWhenSelected;
-        if(!this.openTreeWhenSelected)
+        that.openTreeWhenSelected = !that.openTreeWhenSelected;
+        if(!that.openTreeWhenSelected)
         {
           $('#open-tree-when-selected').buttonMarkup({icon: 'false'});
         }
@@ -1104,8 +1104,8 @@

   guiEvents.on('toggle_notifications', function ()
       {
-        this.showNotifications = !this.showNotifications;
-        if(!this.showNotifications)
+        that.showNotifications = !that.showNotifications;
+        if(!that.showNotifications)
         {
           $('#toggle-notifications').buttonMarkup({icon: 'false'});
         }
diff -r 9e37dafaff16 -r 88a35d757cb1 gz3d/test/gzgui_test.js
--- a/gz3d/test/gzgui_test.js   Wed Oct 18 21:31:04 2017 +0800
+++ b/gz3d/test/gzgui_test.js   Fri Oct 27 09:06:33 2017 +0800
@@ -54,11 +54,12 @@

           expect(gui.showNotifications).toEqual(false);
           guiEvents.emit('toggle_notifications');
-          expect(gui.showNotifications).toEqual(false);
+          expect(gui.showNotifications).toEqual(true);

-          // TODO: test set_view_as after finishing model spawning test.
+          expect(gui.openTreeWhenSelected).toEqual(false);
+          guiEvents.emit('openTreeWhenSelected');
+          expect(gui.openTreeWhenSelected).toEqual(true)

-          // TODO: test delete_entity after finishing model spawning test.
         });
       });

So adding a guiEvents.emit('toggle_notifications'); results in two additional console.log('Notification Toggle');.

I did a quick test with this patch:

content.raw:
Well I could solve the problem of initializing the objects [`gui`, `scene` ...] each `test` and ending with a lot of duplicates by moving all the tests in a single file,  we can portion them with `describes`, wont look so bad.

After some research, I believe karma doesn't run the garbage collector until the page is closed.

I believe we cant force sth like that since this will make us lose the `karma` report which is built incrementally.

What do you think?
content.html:
Well I could solve the problem of initializing the objects [gui, scene ...] each test and ending with a lot of duplicates by moving all the tests in a single file, we can portion them with describes, wont look so bad.

After some research, I believe karma doesn't run the garbage collector until the page is closed.

I believe we cant force sth like that since this will make us lose the karma report which is built incrementally.

What do you think?

content.raw: That didn't have an effect either, I'll try using a different way of testing later this week, maybe use `phantomjs` and `requirejs` I'm currently reading about them.
content.html: That didn't have an effect either, I'll try using a different way of testing later this week, maybe use phantomjs and requirejs I'm currently reading about them.

content.raw: Interesting, thanks for looking into it. It sounds like we're not testing exactly what we think we are, which decreases the value of the test. I'll try to investigate a bit more tomorrow.
content.html: Interesting, thanks for looking into it. It sounds like we're not testing exactly what we think we are, which decreases the value of the test. I'll try to investigate a bit more tomorrow.

content.raw:
Well It seems like the `gzgui_test` is the only test that calls functions twice, even initializes Three.webgl twice even thought the initialization is not in a `beforeEach` .

We can merge it for now and try to increase the coverage later, or continue working on it.
content.html:
Well It seems like the gzgui_test is the only test that calls functions twice, even initializes Three.webgl twice even thought the initialization is not in a beforeEach .

We can merge it for now and try to increase the coverage later, or continue working on it.

content.raw: It could a notification that was fired due to other events being emitted too, I'll have a further look at it, its been some time since I've visited this test :sweat_smile:
content.html: It could a notification that was fired due to other events being emitted too, I'll have a further look at it, its been some time since I've visited this test

I debugged this a little bit by adding some print statements to the gzgui constructor and to the toggle receiver:

diff -r 9e4d45b7bbcd gz3d/build/gz3d.js
--- a/gz3d/build/gz3d.js    Wed Oct 11 07:42:57 2017 +0800
+++ b/gz3d/build/gz3d.js    Tue Oct 10 17:00:50 2017 -0700
@@ -870,6 +870,7 @@
   this.init();
   this.emitter = new EventEmitter2({verbose: true});
   this.guiEvents = guiEvents;
+  console.log('GUI!');
 };

 /**
@@ -1081,6 +1082,7 @@

   guiEvents.on('toggle_notifications', function ()
       {
+        console.log('toggle');
         this.showNotifications = !this.showNotifications;
         if(!this.showNotifications)
         {
diff -r 9e4d45b7bbcd gz3d/test/gzGui_test.js
--- a/gz3d/test/gzGui_test.js   Wed Oct 11 07:42:57 2017 +0800
+++ b/gz3d/test/gzGui_test.js   Tue Oct 10 17:00:50 2017 -0700
@@ -57,7 +57,9 @@
           // expect(gui.openTreeWhenSelected).toEqual(true);

           expect(gui.showNotifications).toEqual(false);
+          console.log('toggle test');
           guiEvents.emit('toggle_notifications');
+          console.log('/toggle test');
           // Why does it fail at this?
           // @gzgui line: 1034.
           // expect(gui.showNotifications).toEqual(false);

And on the output, it looks like there are 2 instances of gzgui being created, and they both receive the toggle event:

hrome 57.0.2987 (Linux 0.0.0) LOG: 'GUI!'

Chrome 57.0.2987 (Linux 0.0.0) LOG: 'THREE.WebGLRenderer', '86'

Chrome 57.0.2987 (Linux 0.0.0) LOG: 'GUI!'

LOG: 'toggle test'
LOG: 'toggle'
LOG: 'toggle'
LOG: '/toggle test'

The first one might be coming from the fixture? Maybe just in case we should create a new one every time on beforeEach?

Not sure if this could be related to the problem.

content.raw:
The files here have to be in a certain order, for example the `jasmine-jquery` has to be after the `jquery` and before the `test`.

I've moved it down to look a little better.
content.html:
The files here have to be in a certain order, for example the jasmine-jquery has to be after the jquery and before the test.

content.raw: Thank you and sorry about that, apparently I accidentally deleted the dependency while merging default :/.

content.raw:
Doing `npm install --save-dev jasmine-jquery` solved the problem. Do you mind updating the pull request to add that dependency, @mohamd_ayman ? Thanks!

~~~
diff -r 565802174ba8 package.json
--- a/package.json	Tue Oct 03 13:42:09 2017 +0800
+++ b/package.json	Mon Oct 09 08:57:11 2017 -0700
@@ -35,6 +35,7 @@
     "grunt-jsdoc": "^2.1.1",
     "istanbul": "^0.4.5",
     "jasmine-core": "^2.8.0",
+    "jasmine-jquery": "^2.1.1",
     "jsdoc": "^3.5.5",
     "karma": "^1.7.0",
     "karma-chrome-launcher": "^2.2.0",
~~~
content.html:
Doing npm install --save-dev jasmine-jquery solved the problem. Do you mind updating the pull request to add that dependency, @mohamd_ayman ? Thanks!
